condition: Good overall. Single plant centered on page. Colors (green, red) present. Dark overpaint on root and leaves. Ink legible throughout; minor ambiguity at line ends (L2, L4) flagged by transcribers with '!' marks.

layout.description: One plant centered on page. Text wraps around the plant in two paragraphs, left- and right-justified.

plant.root: Left-right symmetrical, planar, like a headless stick figure with outstretched arms. Dark overpaint.
plant.branches: Two main branches, almost upright, slightly bent. Irregular thickness. Light-colored with a dark vein along the middle.
plant.leaves: Dark overpaint, shaped like a triangular fan with five lanceolated fingers. Medium-length stalk.
plant.flowers: Three, on tip of main branch. Longish stalk. Chalyx: oblong oval swelling. Petals: many, narrow and long (shaving-brush shape).

petersen_identification.confidence: Tentative. Flower shape and branching match, but leaves of Centaurea cyanus are long/thin with smooth edges, unlike the fan-shaped leaves on f2r.
petersen_identification.historical_use: Infusions of Centaurea cyanus were used as a febrifuge (whole plant) and eye wash (flowers only).

transcription_method: Direct paleographic reading from EVA transcription (H=Hermes primary, cross-checked with C and F) using ZFD 7-layer constraint stack.
